website_summaries.verdict: Each bright yellow strap supports GoPros, waterproof iPhone cases and any other waterproof device that weighs less than 200 grams.
pros: Each strap supports weight up to 7 ounces or 200 grams
Fits most waterproof digital cameras and binoculars
Works with cameras like GoPro, many Panasonic Lumix models and other models
cons: Be careful how vigorously you move your wrist with the float attached – the connector strings can break or detach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent devices
customer_reviews.text: Effective; could float both my Olympus and my GoPro to the surface. However, they are rather large loops. Thus, when down scuba diving, there's no way to tighten the loop around my wrist - so I was worried about them accidentally coming loose. I ended up taking the floating loop off my wrist and securing the thin camera strap onto my wrist. (Photo shows me about 50+ feet down taking photos with a GoPro attached to the floats). Not sure how to fix that, or if it's possible with this type of design, but would have been more comfortable to have the extra security.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: FLOATY saved the DAY (and $450)
customer_reviews.text: Just took my new GoPro 4 out kayaking. I WAITED until I had the Nordic float. THANK GOD! The adhesive tab holding the camera and mount did NOT do its job and the $400 camera and $50 mount ended up in the Gulf of Mexico. HOWEVER, thanks to the floaty, I simply scooped up the camera and mount and muttered both words of thanks that the camera was saved by the float and disgust that the adhesive mount did not do its job... BUT THE FLOATY DID! Just saved me $450.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C.

customer_reviews.title: Save your waterproof camera from a watery grave
customer_reviews.text: The two waterproof cameras I have are not buoyant so if they were to ever slip of my wrist it would be a bad thing... These floats are reasonably priced, brightly colored, smooth and comfortable, and very handy. The two pack came with 4 attachment pieces and the two floats - they connect to each other with a robust plastic connector - which was handy because I could attach the attachment pieces to several cameras and then can snap the flotation part on to whatever I'm using that day. The flotation material appears to be neoprene so I expect it to have a good long lifespan. All in all a great little buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver !
customer_reviews.text: Came back to write about this, I've lost my gopro and got a new one. If only I had this the first time I would have saved a lot of money!! I've attached one float to a gopro 4 silver with the case and a gooseneck and it still floats.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal Suissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome float!
customer_reviews.text: On a recent trip to Florida when I was kayaking, I dropped my digital camera overboard and even though I dove for it I was not able to reach it in time. We were in the calmer waters of a bay however there water had zero clarity. Luckily I was able to search with my feet until I located it. As soon as we returned to our condo, I made this purchase. Awesome float!! I tested it immediately upon arrival in a pool. Don't take the risk I did make sure you have a float! You may not be as lucky as I was.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: My Go To Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to camera strap. Every underwater camera I own has this strap. I've even gifted this strap on my niece's underwater camera. The strap has held up after many trips through saltwater, chlorine, etc. I've had mine for years and this set went on hubby's underwater camera. I searched specifically for this strap and he requested it. Every snorkeler we have run across has asked about this strap, I let them know how well it works. It has never failed me at any depth. It's my security blanket for my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Neal

customer_reviews.title: wonderfully convenient security
customer_reviews.text: I carry both a cell phone and a satellite text communicator on my belt, because I take both a boat and a dirt bike out of cell phone range. Going about my day, I keep the black thread loops and half the black connectors attached, and if I'm going to the boat, snap on the yellow floats. Perfect. I don't have to carry the yellow float to business meetings, but both my phone and my text communicator are protected when I might drop them in the water. The company even sent two spare wrist straps with extra threads and connectors.
customer_reviews.author: tkeithlu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product (Best I found) and a Wonderful Company to Buy From
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the design and appearance, quality and professionalism of the product. The packaging of the two straps is handy since some cameras are a little heavy for one strap, plus I have a second in case my granddaughter loses one. The added value of this company is their follow-up. I had to return the straps because the camera I purchased them for was defective. They followed up to find out what the problem was. When I told them, they graciously replied, showing they had read everything I wrote. VERY PROFESSIONAL and PLEASANT!
customer_reviews.author: pshell

customer_reviews.title: More than paid for itself on first use.
customer_reviews.text: This and JOTO Universal Waterproof Pouch arrived yesterday. Together they already saved my phone. I was kayak fishing and trying to take a photo of my catch on the measuring board. Short story; phone slipped, bag protected, float allowed to retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Glad I picked these up before an ocean trip. I used them for an iPhone 8 with a waterproof case. The floating strap gave me peace of mind while snorkeling in the ocean/hiking around waterfalls/etc. Also--I did not know this when I ordered--but the package came with two normal camera straps that could be swapped out using the same fastener as the yellow floaty straps. This was a nice feature! When I was hiking near cliffs, where I didn't need the float functionality, it was nice to have the plain strap to keep my phone securely on my wrist for pictures.
customer_reviews.author: kidrobotGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough with two
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as replacement for same style in different brand. One doesn’t hold up an iPhone in waterproof case but two will. Makes it very chunky to carry around or swim with but worth the security if you want it for in water pictures. And will be handy for boating in the future. I don’t love how frail the string and attachment clasp seem. But we’ll be triple strapped with the original thin wrist band and to floaters.
customer_reviews.author: StarDate339846

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to take stress free underwater images
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this to allow me to use my underwater camera while snorkeling in Iceland. Before my trip I attached it to the camera and placed them both in a tall bucket of water. The float worked immediately but it wasn’t until the water was high enough that the slack was lost and the camera began to lift from the bottom. Once in Iceland I was completely confident that the camera would float and it would allow me to easily focus on caputuring beautiful images like I did. Thank you so much for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: It floats!
customer_reviews.text: I had been trying to figure out how to attach a float to my phone when I paddle. I really enjoy taking pictures, and the thought of having to dive in to retrieve my phone was not what I wanted to do. Bought a new case for my phone, and it came with a lanyard port! YES! This float attached easily. I left the float in a bowl of water overnight, and it was still floating in the morning! Haven't used it yet, but it's ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Forster

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this negative stars. My GoPro was on this wrist band clipped to my weight belt. I was Freediving in Mexico. And had a week of footage in the camera. We got in the water to swim with sailfish. When I reached for my camera it was gone. The string that attaches to the camera is light monofilament covered with black thread. Way under built and gives you a false sense of security. Don’t trust these.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin 3000

customer_reviews.title: Good float
customer_reviews.text: I thought the product well made, used them for snorkeling and whale watching. I was able to rinse out the sea water fine and they dried relatively quick even in the equatorial environment we were traveling to. Plus perk, the two pack we purchased had two non floating straps as well which made the product that much more of a bargain for us.
customer_reviews.author: Geo-Raider

customer_reviews.title: HOW great. As I gear up for wreck diving season
customer_reviews.text: HOW great. As I gear up for wreck diving season, this ordered product gave me a two for one experience. I bought a new housing for my camera, attached the Nordic Flash float and chunked it into the pool. 3-minutes later, voila, my camera float was at the surface. Very cool and nice that you get two (2) of everything when ordering. I will be using the second one for my dive lamp. Great job and great value by Nordic Flash! I will come back and post a picture of the product in use at the wrecks!
customer_reviews.author: jason blevins

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera float - would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: With the package I got two camera floats, and two separate adjustable wrist straps. Very good design, you can unsnap the float and snap on the wrist strap, for snorkeling or diving. My only concern is the very small line that connects to the camera. I like overkill so I replaced it with a braided 60lb nylon fish line. All water cameras come with too weak of connecting line, but that being said, you would be very hard put to break it.
customer_reviews.author: rcmallory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Float for Compact Cameras
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased an underwater camera and wanted to make sure the camera would not be lost while snorkeling. After several searches and recommendations I settled on the Nordic Flash Waterproof Camera Float. Not only was the float rated to keep a camera of the weight I was using afloat but the bright yellow color would make the camera easy to spot if I became separated from it. I just returned from a cruise to Alaska and one of my shore excursions included snorkeling near Ketchikan. The float performed flawlessly and I was even asked by several members in my group what kind of camera I had as well as brand of float.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Miller

customer_reviews.title: saved my olympus tg-4
customer_reviews.text: while snorkeling some freshwater tropical lakes had to climb a small rock outcropping between two parts of a lake. upon getting back into the water i noticed my olympus tg-4 was missing. looked back to the other side of the rocks and there it was floating nicely. if you are tempted by other brands at least get the yellow color as it stands out in the water.
customer_reviews.author: rfm010

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Now I haven’t tried these out for floatability but they are well made and I have full confidence in they will float my camera. The main thing I wanted to say is they also come with an adjustable wrist strap. Actually two. There are some complaints that they don’t fit tight enough around the wrist. So those complaints have been addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Norton

customer_reviews.title: these word great
customer_reviews.text: I bought the floating handle for my Osmo Action but the camera was too heavy with the metal aluminum case for it to float so I bought 2 Nordic camera floats and tied them together with fishing string and tied them to the camera case. They work perfect, my camera now floats so no fear when I take my camera on my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Russell R. Glerum

customer_reviews.title: Can't say that I've used it (in the water) yet
customer_reviews.text: I'm the proud owner of an olympus "tough" camera, which is a great machine, but would probably sink like a rock. And I think it's only good to 30 feet. I didn't really need two, but that's how it comes. Next time I go snorkeling, I'll attach it. On dry land, the float is comfortable to wear, and certainly prevents you from dropping the camera!
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Phone sunk to the bottom of a lake
customer_reviews.text: This float worked great for awhile. I always attached my phone to it and checked it to make sure it floated. I fell off my paddle board and dropped the phone and both it and the float sunk straight to the bottom of the lake. I have no idea why it stopped floating because its foam but there it is! I lost my phone because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Walden

customer_reviews.title: Kept my Galaxy phone afloat in slightly choppy waters. Bulky but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I used my float with my waterproof phone case and was able to safely take pictures while snorkeling and swimming around the Caribbean. I didn't test the float very much as I kept it around my wrist the whole time but I did test it for a second just to see and it kept my phone afloat. It is a bit cumbersome for someone with small hands/wrists (like myself) and I felt like a SUPER TOURIST with it around my wrist since it is so bright and obvious but it did the job and I am happy that I didn't lose my phone in the process. I count it as a win.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I attached the float to my cellphone for a week of snorkeling and generally being around water all the time. It was very comfortable and reassuring to wear around my wrist. I did not actually try to float the phone in the water, but am assuming it would have worked. I was actually more concerned about the skinny cord it connected to on my lifeproof case.
customer_reviews.author: OBX Mom

customer_reviews.title: Use a tether as back up....my iPhone is at the bottom of the lake
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my waterproof camera the Olympus Tough. Worked great in the ocean and Lake Powell. So when I was headed to kayak Apache lake, I thought nothing of using it for my iPhone XS (substantially less weight - than my camera). Kayak flipped over and the phone was gone -no floating...no bobbing just below the water line.... just gone. Be cautious and have a tether as backup. I'm sorry I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY unless you are simply swimming
customer_reviews.text: I just used these for the first time on a jet ski in the ocean. Luckily I attached both of the floaters to the same phone! Within 15 minutes the first strap broke and the phone fell in, luckily I had the 2nd strap attached too or the phone would have been at the bottom of the ocean! The 2nd strap was frayed as well and ready to break! DO NOT USE these if you are doing anything active, more than swimming in calm water or a pool!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Too big to fit some of us.
customer_reviews.text: No doubt it will work for many people as intended, but it is too big and bulky to feel secure on my wrist, so I worry that my camera will fall overboard. If your wrists are small then you will need a second wrist strap. Also, the nylon string is of the type that will wear out and break. Seller should add extra attachment pieces to the deal as these are not easy to find and replace.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Jaynes

customer_reviews.title: Superior ability to float
customer_reviews.text: The clip is plastic and I am worried that it could break as I do a lot of rough outdoor activities but it has held up so far. The ability to float is awesome! I have a Samsung 8 with a shock proof case so my phone is heavier than most but it doesn't even phase it. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: samantha kotte

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: Bought these straps to use during a trip to Hawai'i. Used them while snorkeling and swimming and they worked great. My camera is a waterproof Nikon Coolpix. Comes with two yellow float wrist straps and two regular wrist straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on Caribbean vacation
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on Caribbean vacation. One loop floated our underwater Olympus no problem. Color made it easy to keep track of. The quick snap-on snap-off attachments & straps worked well too. Good product. I even have an fun picture taken of me staring down at camera when I tested it in a bucket before the trip to be sure it had sufficient buoyancy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you I love this for beach/pool days, it really works and it secures my phone really good I always put both on for extra protection , I wanted this because I like filming/photographing on my phone on my fun moments:)
customer_reviews.author: KrazyJelly

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price
customer_reviews.text: These handles were good but two design flaws have made me not want to use them yet. While they float well the handle is loose on most wrists and the nylon string is very thin. I have a hard time trusting my $350 camera on nylon that thin.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this product while kayaking out on the lake. I am at ease knowing that if I drop my phone in the water, it won't end up in the bottom of the lake, and I cam easily retrieve it. Thank you. It also came with two. Now, whomever is with me, can also use one. This product can only be used if you have a phone case or a pop socket you can strap it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Evanoff

customer_reviews.title: #1 purchase for your underwater camera/phone
customer_reviews.text: Loved it!!! We took it on our Key West trip and used this snorkeling for 3 days. It also came with two extra wrist straps that didn’t float but we could attach to our phones. I’m really happy with this product and price. Totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great float - good for small objects you don't want to lose
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to help float our iPhone cases should we drop them out on the water. I paired these with our floating waterproof phone holders the we also got on Amazon. The lanyard strap attaches to the case and can easily float the case, which also floats, but not as well as it does with a little help from this camera float. We primarily use ours while paddle boarding, so we feed the camera float through the belt of our pfd's and let the phone hang from our waist. The bright yellow makes it easy to see this. I would recommend this for floating small objects that get dropped in the water.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for those items you don't want to loose in the ocean.
customer_reviews.text: I took two of these on a cruise with me and used it to take my underwater camera snorkeling. It works GREAT. I let go of my camera on a regular basis and the floater which I wore on my wrist kept my camera secure. I decided to let go of the handle at one point to see if it would indeed float and hold the weight of my camera to keep it from sinking and ......It works beautifully. When I did come in out of the water the float dried off so easily. In fact it was dry before I was. Great Item.
customer_reviews.author: Soonerbug

customer_reviews.title: Security provided
customer_reviews.text: I knew that I would be swimming in the ocean during my vacation and I didn't want to risk losing two new cameras I recently purchased. I attached a Nordic Flash flotation device to both cameras and felt very secure that neither would sink to the bottom if I lost my grip. I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The product is easily transferable to other cameras too
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. I attached this to my Sony AS250v action cam with theand with only one float it had no problem staying afloat in the ocean. The product is easily transferable to other cameras too, which is an advantage over the stock sony floating mount. I am extremely impressed with this product
customer_reviews.author: Salazar

customer_reviews.title: High res yellow is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of water proof or underwater cameras for use on my jet ski, or when I'm scuba diving. Even though at least one of them is supposed to float, they aren't very visible on the surface. This strap is perfect for making sure they float if accidentally let loose in/under the water, AND the high res yellow will ensure I'll be able to see it bobbing on the surface when I'm looking for it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to attach to my new waterproof camera that I planned to use for some water adventures in Hawaii. I felt they were a great quality product and they fit snugly on my arm, so I felt more secure if I lost my grip on my camera while in the water. I liked the snap feature, as I was able to change easily from this wrist strap to a regular wrist strap with the same type attachment. I have not used these yet to actually "float" my camera, but will probably try that out this summer while kayaking. Then I promise to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Paddeelynn

customer_reviews.title: They work with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and connection easy. I went to my swim club to test them out. One on my binoculars and on on my iPhone in a LifeProof case inside a waterproof pouch. They worked! Even tried to push astound and down beneath the surface but both came to the top. Yellow ones easy to spot so now to try out while kayaking. Tested in 4foot of water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Got these to use with my GoPro (171 grams including waterproof case) and my Samsung S4 with a Joto waterproof case (170 grams). Tested them in a large bucket of water and both times 3/4's of the bright yellow hoop was above water. As an bonus surprise, they threw in a additional third hand strap that doesn't float but will be useful because it cinches down on my wrist very snugly. Great products. Gives me peace of mind for the kayaking, jet-skiing and snorkeling I'll be doing on an upcoming trip.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: If you have a waterproof camera you need these
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these camera floats for about a year now and they are just what anyone with a waterproof camera needs. I have had many waterproof cameras but never a floating strap and it is so nice to not have to worry about it slipping off my wrist and dropping to the depths when snorkeling. The quick release strap is great so you can switch between a floating strap and a standard strap quickly with pretty much no effort. I highly recommend these straps to anyone with a waterproof camera.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeTime

customer_reviews.title: Go for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: Attached these to the end of my selfie stick for uae while snorkeling. Did a good job and did not come apart. The connect switches between float and traditional lanyard. I was worried the connection was not going to be strong enough, but it held up fine. The float kept the stick and GoPro from sinking, so job well done. I did like the ability to change the float out with a lanyard quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Great but way larger than it appears
customer_reviews.text: Way larger than I thought in overall size. I thought it would be similar in size to a bracelet you might wear out to dinner. However, it does stay on your wrist well, it's bulky though (don't expect to fit it in your pocket) but the yellow is easy to find in a dark bag, or lake water, and I just have it attached to my waterproof cell phone case with the float hanging from my slim waist pack on my SUP.
customer_reviews.author: MN Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but started to come apart after some heavy usage
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, kept my Canon DS30 afloat just find in the raging seas while jet skiing! Only problem i had was i didnt want it around my wrist so i moved it up my arm around my bicep, at the end of the day the foam was starting to seperate/rip, my arms arent huge but was a little dissapointed that it was coming apart. It's still usable but this happened after only 1 day of use. I suspect if you dont jet ski with it around your bicep you will get many good years of use out of it. Maybe they will make a heavy duty version of this for hi impact water sport use, either way a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera companion for Kauai
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Olympus TG-4 while on vacation in Kauai, and it worked beautifully. My camera was brand new, and I was somewhat paranoid about losing it in the ocean, so I attached both straps to be on the safe side. Looked a little goofy, but at least I didn't have to worry about it sinking. I purchased this in bright yellow, and it was a perfect contrast again the dark blue ocean; I never really let go of my camera, but if I had, I had no doubt that I would be able to easily see it from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: They work for my intended use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my waterproof cell phone case, and the waterproof bluetooth speaker I use when I paddle board. Easy to spot if the object falls off the board because of waves and gives enough flotation to retrieve them before the ocean claims them. The ocean doesn't believe on anything or anyone, don't expect your object to float forever if they go overboard. They will give you about a minute(If the object has some weight to it) to retrieve them if oceans are choppy. The plus is if your in shallow waters (1-15 ft) you will be able to spot it easily in clear waters, and you can dive down and retrieve your item.
customer_reviews.author: Dante B.

customer_reviews.title: In Nordic Flash We Trust
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend and I, and have been surprised how much we've used them! Any time we're on or near the water, our phones are safe and sound... lake, ocean, kayaking, paddleboarding, and swimming. Photos through the plastic turn out well. Quality product, seal works great. I appreciate the 2 wrist straps (one with flotation, one fabric that tightens). I always wash and dry them out after use. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome floaters!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything on it. I intend to use in my GoPro both of them. What I don't like is that I tried to buy 2 more packages and it wasn't available in Amazon. Thanks !!!
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Came with extra wrist lanyards
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my lifeproof case for my phone. The string was tied by a shoddy knot that came undone after pulling it with medium force. Tied my own knot and it seems like it'll do the trick. Unexpectedly came with two non-floating lanyards too
customer_reviews.author: Rod O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach or pool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product !!! Fit great on a IPhone 6 Plus with a cover; plus, súper fast delivery, right on time for our family vacations. Thanks a lot !!!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Almada

customer_reviews.title: Great for point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea for a waterproof point and shoot camera. (I doubt they would keep up a heavier SLR in underwater case). Worried that my young granddaughter might drop the camera when shooting near water, I bought these for her. So far no drops but tested flotation seems to do the trick. They are a bit bulky for everyday non-water use, but come with a clickon alternate strap - very easy to change. I am impressed by what appears to be quality manufacture and overall attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: pnc

customer_reviews.title: Sealife camera float
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as a float for a Sealife Micro 2 camera. One float works fine in sea water, I was not sure so purchased the set. You might need both in fresh water. Straps work well and the strap is stronger than original wrist strap that came w/ camera. I also like the quick release that came w/ straps. It makes it easy to detach when not needed when using on land.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Saved My New Camera in Rough Water!
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent floats. We just returned from a snorkeling trip to Bonaire. I have a new Fuji XP70 camera. While snorkeling in pretty rough water off Klein Bonaire, I was horrified that the camera was no longer on my wrist! But there it was bobbing in the water right beside me. Whew! This float saved the day. Since the opening is fairly large for my small arm, after that I pushed the float above my elbow where it was nice and snug. Then when I wanted to take a photo or video, it was easy to slide it down.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: They do what they're supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did was put my old iPhone 4 in a waterproof bag and throw it into a pool with these floaties attached while taking video - first with only one floatie attached, then with both. Was curious just how buoyant it was and how quickly it would surface! Each of these floaties in this 2 pack will individually support my iPhone in its DandyCase waterproof bag. Clips feel secure, but I intend to use both floaties at the same time for a little fail-safe redundancy when out on the river. So far, so good! Have worked as advertised! I also like the bright yellow; they're pretty easy to spot in darker water like a river or lake.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Effective float for Olympus TG 5
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I will NEVER loose the camera with this attached! Bright yellow! Tested, and it floats the Olympus TG 5 just fine! Only possible weak link is attachment to camera, but I see no real problem there, either.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Saved my camera!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. First snorkeling trip, jumped out of a boat 1h offshore the Florida Keys with my brand new waterproof camera in my pocket. When I go and try to get my camera: it's gone!! Omg, I panicked. It was such a relief to see it floating just behind me... I love this floater. Got them in a pack of two, one for me and one for my girlfriend. Very good investment (paid around $6 each) to keep your camera afloat!
customer_reviews.author: Chema

customer_reviews.title: A "must have" accessory
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love to accompany me to the beach and trips to the river, and I love taking photos of them having fun in the water. So, when I bought a new waterproof camera, this purchase was a no-brainer; afterall, I didn't want my new camera to sink to the bottom of the ocean! It fits comfortably around your wrist allowing you to swim, and keeps your camera secure while taking pictures in rough surf. And Yes, it floats your camera if you drop it.( I tested it!) would be great for other sinkable items too; such as , car keys . A must have item for the water sport enthusiast!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected and very visible!
customer_reviews.text: They are certainly bigger than I thought they would be. These things look like they could float more than what they are rated at, but I don't know if I would push that too much. I haven't had a chance to use them as a float just yet because the water is still a bit too cool for kayaking but I will update this post if there are any issues holding up a smartphone or camera.
customer_reviews.author: ellzTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Must have product to protect your camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son’s underwater camera. It fits comfortably around his wrist/arm/ankle. It is a must have addition to your camera! Underwater cameras are expensive. This product keeps the camera safe from being lost in the water if you drop it. Perfect color to be seen so your camera is easily found. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: maureen hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for water sports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to float my iPhone (in a waterproof case) when kayaking. The colors were bright. Felt soft and comfortable on my wrists. The floats themselves were great. The black connecting ropes might be a little thin. But you can tie both to your camera if you want to use it in rough water.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my iPhone X Afloat
customer_reviews.text: I used this in Jamaica. Luckily I didn't end up REALLY needing it, but I was worried about dropping my phone in the ocean and having it sink. I did use this in the ocean and pools though, and it easily kept my iPhone X afloat, so I had peace of mind that I wouldn't lose my phone in the Ocean!
customer_reviews.author: SoundsLikeLife

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product and Exceptional Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: The product is fantastic. I used the two floats to protect both my GPro camera and extendable pole. Nordic Flash's Customer Service was top-notch. I corresponded with Maricor and he was great! The customer service he provided me was exceptional. He was very knowledgeable, patient, and followed up on every question I had. I'm so impressed with him. Nordic Flash should be thankful for his service.
customer_reviews.author: Janette K.

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years in and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: These are great, do what they are supposed to do, float a camera. I use it with an Olympus TG-5 and other cameras for snorkelling. Hundreds of dives and they are still in great condition. Highly recommended. Durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: and they floated on the water just fine (although there was no true usage
customer_reviews.text: I used these to float my iPhone 7+ during a float trip, and they floated on the water just fine (although there was no true usage, just a test at the beginning to make sure they performed as promised). I used this as an added safety feature to my waterproof phone bag and felt much more comfortable about not loosing my phone with these attached. My only concern was the potentially easy-to-break clasps, but since I had two, I figured both wouldn't break at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why it didn’t float, but my phone sank with this. Don’t attach a camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Attached this device to my phone for my upcoming River Float. Gave it a test run in the pool prior to my trip. My phone sank. Not quite like a rock, but a slow sink. Promptly returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Birkhead

customer_reviews.title: Good, kinda
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of "float" and floated my Fuji point and shoot camera well. The loop was big enough to stretch around an extra large wrist and small enough not to fall off a child's. I was fearful of the very thin line used to connect it to the camera but didn't have any trouble. I did have a failure of one of the plastic quick disconnects, half of it broke (I'm not sure how) but the remaining half still functioned. Hence the 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I took these to attach to my go pro and they worked very well. I had no problem attaching them to the go pro, and they worked well. I did not have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebomber

customer_reviews.title: Works as it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a snorkel trip to the Bahamas to keep my Nikon camera afloat. Worked as design. A single float was able to keep my camera on the surface. I have bigger hands and wrists so at no time did it feel like it was going to slip off but the material also helped keep it secure (not smooth and slippery). Also came with 2 non-floating wrist straps which are useful too.
customer_reviews.author: Kainoa68

customer_reviews.title: better safe than sorry!
customer_reviews.text: bought this in preparation for a trip to thailand where we will be doing a lot of water activities and taking pictures with our iphones (inside waterproof pouches). this is a great idea and an investment well worth it to prevent losing our $600+ phones. the floaties look well constructed and brightly colored for easy spotting. looking forward to being able to have our phones around without worrying about losing them to the bottom of the ocean!
customer_reviews.author: vcw

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: Used both floats (out ofnervousness) on my generic go-pro camera, but one would have been enough. Comfortable and fit every hand size in our family.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your valuables afloat! Would not go without it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my phone when kayaking. I feel like my phone could not be any more safe. Before this purchase I have lost more than one phone to the seas. That's a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This product is outstanding. I tried it out in the pool today And it worked perfect. My 6.8 ounce finepix ex130 floated just fine on one strap. The ex130 is not listed on the list of cameras but it should be. The company was great.
customer_reviews.author: O. K. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: A lifejacket for your phone!
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I used it to hook onto a water proof phone case. And it still floats with the weight of my phone (galaxy s7). I felt more confident having this on the case because if I dropped it I knew it would still be on the top of the water and not sinking to the bottom. The string that connects to the item seems very thin and weak so I am hoping it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: I love the security it gave me knowing i wont lose ...
customer_reviews.text: attached this to my new gopro camera for my trip to hawaii. I love the security it gave me knowing i wont lose my camera and it was quite comfy to wear as well (soft and light). It's a nice touch that they have a snap on/off mechanism so if i'm on land, it's easy to take it off to not be so bulky. I was able to swim with sea turtles with it, and then let my camera go so i could have two hands to grab my boogie board as well. It's also super nice to have 2nd one as backup or for 2nd camera if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chai Tea Latte

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for our GoPro and waterproof camera for a recent trip to Hawaii. They worked perfectly and gave us the peace of mind to swim, snorkel and horse around in the pool with our cameras and our busy kid! Not to mention, the yellow straps made the cameras easy to find in my super-packed beach bag. Speedy delivery and friendly service, too!
customer_reviews.author: Neesy818

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. This float is especially a great design for the way the it sticks up out of the water making it easier to see.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Look well made and prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.text: The straps arrived on time and appear to be well made. Included were the expected 2 floating straps and a nice standard wrist strap. They all use the same style removable camera side fastener, so switching from floaty to standard strap doesn't require a fussy complete removal. If they hold up after my vacation, I will bump the review to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Floats my pocket camera-
customer_reviews.text: Works great and camera floats if dropped in water perfectly . It floats my pocket camera just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool.
customer_reviews.text: It is very great tool. Its is a little bit big for my arms, but I can recommend this product. I will use it for other things too.
customer_reviews.author: Zolanana

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a cruise. Kept 1 for us, and gave 1 to my parents who were going on a cruise a couple months later. Both of ours came in handy (not that we lost the cameras and these helped) as we were able to 'set out cameras down' so to speak, while we were in the water and could adjust ourselves as needed. Very convenient and we only needed 1 to support our cameras. I have a fujifilm finepix and they have a nikon coolpix.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie W

customer_reviews.title: great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: great value for the price. I bought these for my GoPro and love them. And when not in the water, its great for hanging on the wrist instead of the bulky floats out there. It also works exceptionally well when sailing. The camera went overboard and it was easy to pluck out of the water. Would buy them again, great follow up by the company too.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be cumbesome...but they are not. I tested them in a pool and found that just one floated my waterproof Nikon Coolpix AS120. I use these with my waterproof cell phone bags as well. Easy detachable from loop so loop stays with the device, while the float can be detached. Nice for a camera to put back into a normal camera case. Nice not to worry about dropping anything. Easy to use when snorkeling. Used them in the Dominican Republic for 3 hours a day for 5 days. Not much effort to have under water. Will buy more!
customer_reviews.author: RWK Bear

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great to use during our snorkeling trips on The Big ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have been great to use during our snorkeling trips on The Big Island. Unfortunately my daughter had an allergic reaction to I’m assuming the fabric, and we had to purchase a different type of float from the dive shop in Kona.
customer_reviews.author: MarshmallowChicken

customer_reviews.title: Add one even if your handle floats!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Lanyard. comfortable and High visibility. Many handles available for GoPros are dark and manufactured with inexpensive plastic with questionable flotation value. This makes this floating bright yellow lanyard a great idea. Although I had a high quality handle and wasn't worried about its flotation, I was worried about seeing it in the water.With this lanyard I wasn't worried about seeing it in the dark water and had the added benefit of additional buoyancy.
customer_reviews.author: Gear83401

customer_reviews.title: Highly buoyant, highly visible, works great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the set of 2 of these. They showed up promptly and were perfect for keeping my GoPro (in waterproof holder with head strap) afloat in a swimming pool or in ocean surf conditions. One was enough for high buoyancy. It floated well above the water's surface and the bright yellow made it easy to spot when it came off my head in the surf. I gave the second one to my son for his GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Customer

customer_reviews.title: We tried it out with my husband's cell phone in a waterproof case and it floated high and was easy to spot
customer_reviews.text: The quality of product, the packing, the shipping speed exceeded our expectations. We tried it out with my husband's cell phone in a waterproof case and it floated high and was easy to spot. We are kayakers and know we can use this product to keep our phones afloat during our fun. Next stop - the ocean - to take photos while boogie boarding. That will be a great test - we are sure our phones will keep afloat.
customer_reviews.author: msynergy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding design, easy to remove the float, ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding design, easy to remove the float, making it easier to pocket the camera when away from the water. Having two floats in the package is a great idea, in case the second one is needed for a heavier camera, or for a second device. Certainly the best floats [and the best instructions] we've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem outrageously large like some people claim but it is a good size
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem outrageously large like some people claim but it is a good size. If you plan on using this with a Gopole or chest mount or any other mount that you plan on using that you don't directly hold the camera, you'll just have to thread the mount through the handle so it doesn't get in your shots. When I use my selfie stick, I thread the stick though the handle, or my chest mount I put my shoulder strap through the handle. I have a non floater selfie stick which probably weighs 1-2 pounds maybe more and one of these floaters brings it to the top. Must have for any time you're on or in deep water.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Colson

customer_reviews.title: Scuba Diving
customer_reviews.text: These are used on an expensive underwater camera. Fit and quality are perfect. If you are looking for a functional, comfortable, wrist strap...this is it.
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: These were great to keep our phone and camera afloat while snorkeling. Easy to spot and very buoyant!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Great floats for snorkelling with light-weight camera
customer_reviews.text: We attached one to each of our small underwater cameras and kept around our wrists. Gave us confidence because they floated as promised, and didn't interfere with swimming/snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Bright and will float a GoPro. No issues!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Had them tied to two GoPros in a tubing river run and at the beach. Floated just fine.
customer_reviews.author: WiredMAN

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great I used it as back up for my gopro handle but works great on its own.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Work as Expected
customer_reviews.text: -Adds flotation -Wrist strap is durable and easy to detach, more useful than you realize. -Low price. -Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pelanth

customer_reviews.title: It works with Nikon AW120
customer_reviews.text: I just tested to see whether my Nikon AW120 (7.5 oz including the battery) will be floated or not. It works as advertised. You definitely need two of them in order to make it floats. That made things a bit clunky. The only thing I am worried about is make sure to snap that lock in place. My 6 years old son was playing with the lock and I am afraid if I forgot to check the strap lock, the float would come apart from camera because one float would not be enough for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CA Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at keeping camera afloat.
customer_reviews.text: I chose the bright yellow color & used it with a waterproof camera on a trip to Hawaii. Great for snorkeling & on a whale watching trip, or anytime I wanted to keep the camera handy & safe.
customer_reviews.author: LornaH50

customer_reviews.title: Was looking at the different options prior to buying & am very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: "This worked perfectly to keep my GoPro 4 silver combined with SeaLife Underwater Camera Pole afloat while snorkeling in the Caribbean. I did use both floats in tandem, tested it prior to heading into the deep water. It also added visibility for boaters while in the water. Was looking at the different options prior to buying & am very happy with this."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nordic Flash Waterproof Camera Float - Pack of 2 - Bright Yellow
product_meta.description:
**WARNING! Don't Lose Your Camera When Snorkeling or Swimming! This Waterproof Camera Floating Strap Will Save You a Lot of Headache 


The Best Investment to Protect Your Waterproof Camera!
- Fits most cameras (and phone cases) 
- Slides easily onto your wrist 
- Easy to spot in the water 
- Each strap is made to float waterproof cameras up to 7 ounces/200grams 


Two Is Better Than One
Camera floating straps are usually made for smaller cameras, BUT this listing is for TWO camera floaters so you can simply connect both of them to your camera for added protection! 


Keep Your Digital Memories Safe
➤ Always make sure you've connected the camera properly to the floating strap 
➤ Connect both the straps to your camera for added protection 
➤ Lasso your cameras strap to the floating device itself for extra safety (recommended for rough waters) 


Some Waterproof Camera that the Floating Strap Is Suitable for: Coleman: Xtreme C5WP 
Canon: D10, D20 
Nikon: AW1, AW110, AW100, S31, S30 
Casio: EXILIM EX-G1 
Sony: Cyber-shot DSC-TF1, TX5, TX10, TX20, TX200V 
Pentax: WG-1, WG-2, Optio W90, W80, W60, W30, W20 
Kodak: Sport C123, Playsport Zx5(vi-cam), Playsport Zx3(vi-cam), PlayFull(vi-cam) 
Fuji: Finepix XP10, XP30, XP50, XP60, XP100, XP150, XP170, XP200, Z33WP, Z70 
Panasonic: TS25, TS5, TS1, TS2, TS3, TS4, TS10, TS20 
Olympus: TG-630 iHS, TG-2 iHS, Tough 8010, TG-820iHS, TG-810, TG-620 iHS, TG-610, TG-320, TG-310, TG-1iHS, 1050 Inside Package: ✓ 2x Camera Floats ✓ 1x FREE Regular Hand Strap Our Guarantee We are so confident in our Nordic Flash accessories that we offer a 1 Year Manufacturer's Warranty. Click the Add to Cart Button at the Top of this Page to Protect Your Waterproof Camera Now!
feature_bullets: Don't lose your camera when swimming or snorkeling, this is a cheap insurance!
Easy to spot bright marine-yellow fabric, made of soft foam-filled neoprene
Comfortable floating strap that easily slips onto your wrist
This listing is for 2 (two) floating straps that fit most waterproof digital cameras and binoculars (camera/binoculars not included in the listing)
Each strap is made to float waterproof cameras up to 7 ounces/200grams
